p: In virus surveillance, collected samples are subjected to a series of time-consuming steps, such as ultracentrifugation and cell culture, to enrich virus particles or amplify virus titers ( 3, 14, 21 â€“ 23). In addition, many viruses are not easily culturable, and bias is often introduced during amplification, leading to artifacts in the sequence data ( 14, 24). Even standard methods require a laboratory with proper infrastructure and are time intensive, ranging from several hours to days. Unfortunately, such methodologies for viral enrichment are impractical when samples are time-sensitive or have variable viral titers.
